TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit OpacityConverter extends System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter

Docs.summary: Provides a type converter to convert opacity values to and from a string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Typically, you do not directly create an instance of an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OpacityConverter>. Instead, you call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> class. For more information about type converters and to view code examples, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/visualstudio/visual-studio-2013/ayybcxe5(v=vs.120)).

remarks.format:
## Remarks This is the default constructor supplied by the compiler.
Typically, you do not directly create an instance of an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OpacityConverter>. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> class. For more information, see the code examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `sourceType` is expected to be a <xref:System.String>.

block.para:
Override this method to provide your own conversion requirements.
You can use the parameter to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. The parameter may be , so you should always verify the contents. Also, properties on the may also return .

abstract member ConvertFrom : System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext * System.Globalization.CultureInfo * obj -> obj override this.ConvertFrom : System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext * System.Globalization.CultureInfo * obj -> obj

Docs.param: A that provides information about the context of a type converter.
The locale information for the conversion.
Docs.summary: Converts the specified object to the converter's native type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OpacityConverter.ConvertFrom%2A> method is specialized to convert <xref:System.String> values that represent percentages or decimal fractions to their corresponding <xref:System.Double> values, which represent the opacity as a percentage. Types other than <xref:System.String> are passed to the base class implementation of this method.

Docs.exception: The object was not a supported type for the conversion.

could not be properly converted to type .
-or-
The resulting converted was less than zero percent or greater than one hundred percent.

block.para:

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OpacityConverter.ConvertTo%2A> method is specialized to convert integral values to their <xref:System.String> percentage representations. Other types are passed to the base class implementation of this method.

block.para:
Override this method to provide your own conversion requirements.
You can use the parameter to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. The parameter may be , so you should always verify the contents. Also, properties on the may also return .
The resultant object is a representing the percentage of opacity.
